013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ObjectUtils.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022import org.apache.http.*;
023import org.apache.http.message.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
027
028
029/**
030 * Describes a single media type used in content negotiation between an HTTP client and server, as described in
031 * Section 14.1 and 14.7 of RFC2616 (the HTTP/1.1 specification).
032 *
033 * <ul class='seealso'>
034 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
035 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
036 * </ul>
037 */
038@BeanIgnore
039public class MediaType implements Comparable<MediaType>  {
040
041   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
042   // Static
043   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
044
045   /** Represents an empty media type object. */
046   public static final MediaType EMPTY = new MediaType("/*");
047
048   private static final Cache<String,MediaType> CACHE = Cache.of(String.class, MediaType.class).build();
049
050   /** Reusable predefined media type */
051   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
052   public static final MediaType
053      CSV = of("text/csv"),
054      HTML = of("text/html"),
055      JSON = of("application/json"),
056      MSGPACK = of("octal/msgpack"),
057      PLAIN = of("text/plain"),
058      UON = of("text/uon"),
059      URLENCODING = of("application/x-www-form-urlencoded"),
060      XML = of("text/xml"),
061      XMLSOAP = of("text/xml+soap"),
062
063      RDF = of("text/xml+rdf"),
064      RDFABBREV = of("text/xml+rdf+abbrev"),
065      NTRIPLE = of("text/n-triple"),
066      TURTLE = of("text/turtle"),
067      N3 = of("text/n3")
068   ;
069
070   /**
071    * Returns the media type for the specified string.
072    * The same media type strings always return the same objects so that these objects
073    * can be compared for equality using '=='.
074    *
075    * <ul class='notes'>
076    *    <li class='note'>
077    *       Spaces are replaced with <js>'+'</js> characters.
078    *       This gets around the issue where passing media type strings with <js>'+'</js> as HTTP GET parameters
079    *       get replaced with spaces by your browser.  Since spaces aren't supported by the spec, this
080    *       is doesn't break anything.
081    *    <li class='note'>
082    *       Anything including and following the <js>';'</js> character is ignored (e.g. <js>";charset=X"</js>).
083    * </ul>
084    *
085    * @param value
086    *    The media type string.
087    *    Will be lowercased.
088    *    Returns <jk>null</jk> if input is null or empty.
089    * @return A cached media type object.
090    */
091   public static MediaType of(String value) {
092      return value == null ? null : CACHE.get(value, ()->new MediaType(value));
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Same as {@link #of(String)} but allows you to specify the parameters.
097    *
098    *
099    * @param value
100    *    The media type string.
101    *    Will be lowercased.
102    *    Returns <jk>null</jk> if input is null or empty.
103    * @param parameters The media type parameters.  If <jk>null</jk>, they're pulled from the media type string.
104    * @return A new media type object, cached if parameters were not specified.
105    */
106   public static MediaType of(String value, NameValuePair...parameters) {
107      if (parameters.length == 0)
108         return of(value);
109      return isEmpty(value) ? null : new MediaType(value, parameters);
110   }
111
112   /**
113    * Same as {@link #of(String)} but allows you to construct an array of <c>MediaTypes</c> from an
114    * array of strings.
115    *
116    * @param values
117    *    The media type strings.
118    * @return
119    *    An array of <c>MediaType</c> objects.
120    *    <br>Always the same length as the input string array.
121    */
122   public static MediaType[] ofAll(String...values) {
123      MediaType[] mt = new MediaType[values.length];
124      for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
125         mt[i] = of(values[i]);
126      return mt;
127   }
128
129   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
130   // Instance
131   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
132
133   private final String string;                          // The entire unparsed value.
134   private final String mediaType;                      // The "type/subtype" portion of the media type..
135   private final String type;                           // The media type (e.g. "text" for Accept, "utf-8" for Accept-Charset)
136   private final String subType;                        // The media sub-type (e.g. "json" for Accept, not used for Accept-Charset)
137   private final String[] subTypes;                     // The media sub-type (e.g. "json" for Accept, not used for Accept-Charset)
138   private final String[] subTypesSorted;               // Same as subTypes, but sorted so that it can be used for comparison.
139   private final boolean hasSubtypeMeta;                // The media subtype contains meta-character '*'.
140
141   private final NameValuePair[] parameters;            // The media type parameters (e.g. "text/html;level=1").  Does not include q!
142
143   /**
144    * Constructor.
145    *
146    * @param mt The media type string.
147    */
148   public MediaType(String mt) {
149      this(parse(mt));
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Constructor.
154    *
155    * @param mt The media type string.
156    * @param parameters The media type parameters.  If <jk>null</jk>, they're pulled from the media type string.
157    */
158   public MediaType(String mt, NameValuePair[] parameters) {
159      this(parse(mt), parameters);
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * Constructor.
164    *
165    * @param e The parsed media type string.
166    */
167   public MediaType(HeaderElement e) {
168      this(e, null);
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Constructor.
173    *
174    * @param e The parsed media type string.
175    * @param parameters Optional parameters.
176    */
177   public MediaType(HeaderElement e, NameValuePair[] parameters) {
178      mediaType = e.getName();
179
180      if (parameters == null) {
181         parameters = e.getParameters();
182         for (int i = 0; i < parameters.length; i++) {
183            if (parameters[i].getName().equals("q")) {
184               parameters = Arrays.copyOfRange(parameters, 0, i);
185               break;
186            }
187         }
188      }
189      for (int i = 0; i < parameters.length; i++)
190         parameters[i] = new BasicNameValuePair(parameters[i].getName(), parameters[i].getValue());
191      this.parameters = parameters;
192
193      String x = mediaType.replace(' ', '+');
194      int i = x.indexOf('/');
195      type = (i == -1 ? x : x.substring(0, i));
196      subType = (i == -1 ? "*" : x.substring(i+1));
197
198      subTypes = StringUtils.split(subType, '+');
199      subTypesSorted = Arrays.copyOf(subTypes, subTypes.length);
200      Arrays.sort(this.subTypesSorted);
201      hasSubtypeMeta = ArrayUtils.contains("*", this.subTypes);
202
203      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
204      sb.append(mediaType);
205      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
206         sb.append(';').append(p.getName()).append('=').append(p.getValue());
207      this.string = sb.toString();
208   }
209
210   /**
211    * Returns the <js>'type'</js> fragment of the <js>'type/subType'</js> string.
212    *
213    * @return The media type.
214    */
215   public final String getType() {
216      return type;
217   }
218
219   /**
220    * Returns the <js>'subType'</js> fragment of the <js>'type/subType'</js> string.
221    *
222    * @return The media subtype.
223    */
224   public final String getSubType() {
225      return subType;
226   }
227
228   /**
229    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the subtype contains the specified <js>'+'</js> delimited subtype value.
230    *
231    * @param st
232    *    The subtype string.
233    *    Case is ignored.
234    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the subtype contains the specified subtype string.
235    */
236   public final boolean hasSubType(String st) {
237      if (st != null)
238         for (String s : subTypes)
239            if (st.equalsIgnoreCase(s))
240               return true;
241      return false;
242   }
243
244   /**
245    * Returns the subtypes broken down by fragments delimited by <js>"'"</js>.
246    *
247    * <P>
248    * For example, the media type <js>"text/foo+bar"</js> will return a list of
249    * <code>[<js>'foo'</js>,<js>'bar'</js>]</code>
250    *
251    * @return An unmodifiable list of subtype fragments.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
252    */
253   public final List<String> getSubTypes() {
254      return ulist(subTypes);
255   }
256
257   /**
258    * Performs an action on the subtypes broken down by fragments delimited by <js>"'"</js>.
259    *
260    * @param action The action to perform.
261    * @return This object.
262    */
263   public final MediaType forEachSubType(Consumer<String> action) {
264      for (String s : subTypes)
265         action.accept(s);
266      return this;
267   }
268
269   /**
270    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this media type subtype contains the <js>'*'</js> meta character.
271    *
272    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this media type subtype contains the <js>'*'</js> meta character.
273    */
274   public final boolean isMetaSubtype() {
275      return hasSubtypeMeta;
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Returns a match metric against the specified media type where a larger number represents a better match.
280    *
281    * <p>
282    * This media type can contain <js>'*'</js> metacharacters.
283    * <br>The comparison media type must not.
284    *
285    * <ul>
286    *    <li>Exact matches (e.g. <js>"text/json"</js>/</js>"text/json"</js>) should match
287    *       better than meta-character matches (e.g. <js>"text/*"</js>/</js>"text/json"</js>)
288    *    <li>The comparison media type can have additional subtype tokens (e.g. <js>"text/json+foo"</js>)
289    *       that will not prevent a match if the <c>allowExtraSubTypes</c> flag is set.
290    *       The reverse is not true, e.g. the comparison media type must contain all subtype tokens found in the
291    *       comparing media type.
292    *       <ul>
293    *          <li>We want the {@link JsonSerializer} (<js>"text/json"</js>) class to be able to handle requests for <js>"text/json+foo"</js>.
294    *          <li>We want to make sure {@link org.apache.juneau.json.Json5Serializer} (<js>"text/json5"</js>) does not handle
295    *             requests for <js>"text/json"</js>.
296    *       </ul>
297    *       More token matches should result in a higher match number.
298    * </ul>
299    *
300    * The formula is as follows for <c>type/subTypes</c>:
301    * <ul>
302    *    <li>An exact match is <c>100,000</c>.
303    *    <li>Add the following for type (assuming subtype match is &lt;0):
304    *    <ul>
305    *       <li><c>10,000</c> for an exact match (e.g. <js>"text"</js>==<js>"text"</js>).
306    *       <li><c>5,000</c> for a meta match (e.g. <js>"*"</js>==<js>"text"</js>).
307    *    </ul>
308    *    <li>Add the following for subtype (assuming type match is &lt;0):
309    *    <ul>
310    *       <li><c>7,500</c> for an exact match (e.g. <js>"json+foo"</js>==<js>"json+foo"</js> or <js>"json+foo"</js>==<js>"foo+json"</js>)
311    *       <li><c>100</c> for every subtype entry match (e.g. <js>"json"</js>/<js>"json+foo"</js>)
312    *    </ul>
313    * </ul>
314    *
315    * @param o The media type to compare with.
316    * @param allowExtraSubTypes If <jk>true</jk>,
317    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the media types match.
318    */
319   public final int match(MediaType o, boolean allowExtraSubTypes) {
320
321      if (o == null)
322         return -1;
323
324      // Perfect match
325      if (this == o || (type.equals(o.type) && subType.equals(o.subType)))
326         return 100000;
327
328      int c = 0;
329
330      if (type.equals(o.type))
331         c += 10000;
332      else if ("*".equals(type) || "*".equals(o.type))
333         c += 5000;
334
335      if (c == 0)
336         return 0;
337
338      // Subtypes match but are ordered different
339      if (ArrayUtils.equals(subTypesSorted, o.subTypesSorted))
340         return c + 7500;
341
342      for (String st1 : subTypes) {
343         if ("*".equals(st1))
344            c += 0;
345         else if (ArrayUtils.contains(st1, o.subTypes))
346            c += 100;
347         else if (o.hasSubtypeMeta)
348            c += 0;
349         else
350            return 0;
351      }
352      for (String st2 : o.subTypes) {
353         if ("*".equals(st2))
354            c += 0;
355         else if (ArrayUtils.contains(st2, subTypes))
356            c += 100;
357         else if (hasSubtypeMeta)
358            c += 0;
359         else if (! allowExtraSubTypes)
360            return 0;
361         else
362            c += 10;
363      }
364
365      return c;
366   }
367
368   /**
369    * Returns the additional parameters on this media type.
370    *
371    * <p>
372    * For example, given the media type string <js>"text/html;level=1"</js>, will return a map
373    * with the single entry <code>{level:[<js>'1'</js>]}</code>.
374    *
375    * @return The map of additional parameters, or an empty map if there are no parameters.
376    */
377   public List<NameValuePair> getParameters() {
378      return ulist(parameters);
379   }
380
381   /**
382    * Performs an action on the additional parameters on this media type.
383    *
384    * @param action The action to perform.
385    * @return This object.
386    */
387   public MediaType forEachParameter(Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
388      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
389         action.accept(p);
390      return this;
391   }
392
393   /**
394    * Returns the additional parameter on this media type.
395    *
396    * @param name The additional parameter name.
397    * @return The parameter value, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
398    */
399   public String getParameter(String name) {
400      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
401         if (eq(name, p.getName()))
402            return p.getValue();
403      return null;
404   }
405
406   /**
407    * Given a list of media types, returns the best match for this <c>Content-Type</c> header.
408    *
409    * <p>
410    * Note that fuzzy matching is allowed on the media types where the <c>Content-Types</c> header may
411    * contain additional subtype parts.
412    * <br>For example, given a <c>Content-Type</c> value of <js>"text/json+activity"</js>,
413    * the media type <js>"text/json"</js> will match if <js>"text/json+activity"</js> or <js>"text/activity+json"</js>
414    * isn't found.
415    * <br>The purpose for this is to allow parsers to match when artifacts such as <c>id</c> properties are
416    * present in the header.
417    *
418    * @param mediaTypes The media types to match against.
419    * @return The index into the array of the best match, or <c>-1</c> if no suitable matches could be found.
420    */
421   public int match(List<MediaType> mediaTypes) {
422      int matchQuant = 0, matchIndex = -1;
423
424      for (int i = 0; i < mediaTypes.size(); i++) {
425         MediaType mt = mediaTypes.get(i);
426         int matchQuant2 = mt.match(this, true);
427         if (matchQuant2 > matchQuant) {
428            matchQuant = matchQuant2;
429            matchIndex = i;
430         }
431      }
432      return matchIndex;
433   }
434
435   private static HeaderElement parse(String value) {
436      HeaderElement[] elements = BasicHeaderValueParser.parseElements(emptyIfNull(trim(value)), null);
437      return (elements.length > 0 ? elements[0] : new BasicHeaderElement("", ""));
438   }
439
440   @Override /* Object */
441   public String toString() {
442      return string;
443   }
444
445   @Override /* Object */
446   public int hashCode() {
447      return string.hashCode();
448   }
449
450   @Override /* Object */
451   public boolean equals(Object o) {
452      return (o instanceof MediaType) && eq(this, (MediaType)o, (x,y)->eq(x.string, y.string));
453   }
454
455   @Override
456   public final int compareTo(MediaType o) {
457      return toString().compareTo(o.toString());
458   }
459}
